definition: to lead/to be in front
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc
early/prior/former/in advance/first
a long way in front/to lead by a wide margin
lead(ing) position

sentences.english: Our team was in the lead at half time.
He was 2-0 up and maybe kept the ball for a second or two longer.
sentences.chinese: 0领先并可能想再停住球多一两秒。

sentences.english: Before the end of the race,he lapped the other runners.
sentences.chinese: 赛跑结束前，他比其他赛跑者领先了一圈。

sentences.english: Our goal is your market lead. Right from the start.
sentences.chinese: 我们的目标是让您在市场竞争中一直保持领先。

sentences.english: The leading cause of dental implant failures are infections following a dental implant.
sentences.chinese: 领先的种植牙失败的原因是感染后牙种植体。

sentences.english: Hong Kong Air Cargo Terminals Limited is one of the leading air cargo terminal operators in the world.
sentences.chinese: 香港空运货站是世界领先的航空货运站之一。

sentences.english: The US is far ahead," he said.
sentences.chinese: 美国已经在方面遥遥领先了，”他说。

sentences.english: Although the gendarmerie is ahead of the market the market is catching up.
sentences.chinese: 虽然宪兵，是市场上的领先地位，市场正在迎头赶上。

sentences.english: Now the visiting team is ahead.
Because of this, the Cutty Sark lost her lead.
sentences.chinese: 因为这个原因，卡蒂萨克号失去了领先的地位。

sentences.english: The horse won the race by two lengths.
sentences.chinese: 那马以两个自首至尾的距离领先赢得该场比赛。

sentences.english: With these sprigs just fly ahead of the other pocket bikes in the race.
sentences.chinese: 有了这些小枝只是飞领先于其他口袋自行车在比赛中。

sentences.english: I'd say they took the lead in 2005.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他们是从二零零五年开始领先的。

sentences.english: The company's technology and quality are in the same industry-leading level.
sentences.chinese: 本公司的技术及质量都处于同行业中的领先水平。

sentences.english: As an individual country, America still leads the world by some distance.
sentences.chinese: 按单国来论，美国在世界上仍然遥遥领先。

sentences.english: White Jersey for the Best Young Rider, for riders no more than 25 years old in the year of the race.
sentences.chinese: 总成绩在25岁一下选手中领先者便可穿白衫。

definition: to reverse (the score)/to pull off a comeback/to take the lead
to fall behind/to lag (in technology etc)/backward/to retrogress
score
half of a game or contest/half-court
a long way in front/to lead by a wide margin
to go smoothly/to come off/to succeed
inessentials/minor detail
to equalize/to level the score/to pull back the advantage
superiority/dominance/advantage
opening (chess etc)/early stage of game, match, work, activity etc
to take the lead in a race/to set the pace
to hit (a target)
lapse/mistake/to make a mistake/fault/service fault (in volleyball, tennis etc)
final segment/last stage
to catch up vigorously/to set off in hot pursuit
to pull back/to regain (one's dignity etc)/to recover from (an adverse situation)/to turn the tables
